About Me

Getting to know me...

BIO

My name is Vince Wolfe and I am 27 years old. I was born and raised in Denver, CO. Till recently discovering my passion for programming I've been working for the City of Thornton for just under 5 years as a heavy equipment operator II. My plan is to learn as much about programming as I can to secure a position as a Jr Web-Developer; from there I plan to continue learning and developing my skill set. I love that there will always be something to learn and that there are always new tools(Frameworks/Languages/updates) to use which brings a challange I enjoy. Programming is my passion; with continued dedication and consistency I will learn what it takes to become a top notch Software Engineer.

Galvanize

Student

I've attended multiple courses provided by Galvanize to learn and sharpen my knowledge about programming. I learned basic HTML along with CSS and an introductionn to Javascript. While there I was also introduced to the command line.

Self taught

Learned to program from various sources on my own

After going to a few "learn to code" classes I found my passion for programming and my love for it has taken off since. I've spent my early mornings, nights, and weekends studying and implementing coding into my life. Learning as much as I can from resources such as Udemy, Udacity, SoloLearn, YoutTube, and networking with students/staff at Galvanize; my knowledge has grown significantlly in the past few months and it continues to grow. I'm facinated with the endless possibilities of what you can create with so many different tools available to the Developer. I began to enjoy problem solving because it leads to a full understanding of why things work and why other dont.

Projects

Personal/Freelance

Most of my experience has been with personal projects that you can view in the "My work" section of this portfolio. I've built most of my projects with an HTML and CSS base with some projects containing Javascript; which I am currently learning. I'm currently working on a freelance project for a client who is a personal trainer.
